meanings.definition: The emotion of great delight or happiness.
meanings.sent1: Her face lit up with joyance when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter filled the room with joyance.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's joyance at seeing its owner was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a place of pure joyance, blooming with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The joyance in her eyes was unmistakable as she opened the gift.

meanings.definition: The state of experiencing pleasure or happiness.
meanings.sent1: The music brought a sense of joyance to the listeners.
meanings.sent2: The vacation was filled with moments of pure joyance.
meanings.sent3: His joyance at winning the game was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the essence of joyance in every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The joyance in her voice was infectious, spreading happiness to all around.

meanings.definition: The act of rejoicing or celebrating.
meanings.sent1: The joyance of the crowd could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The joyance of the wedding guests filled the air with happiness.
meanings.sent3: The joyance of the team after their victory was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The joyance of the festival was like a wave of happiness washing over the town.
meanings.sent5: The joyance of the parade brought the community together in celebration.
